metadata.title: CVE-2019-6976 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
libvips before 8.7.4 generates output images from uninitialized memorylocations when processing corrupted input image data becauseiofuncs/memory.c does not zero out allocated memory. This can result inleaking raw process memory contents through the output image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-6976` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-vips-8.0 - 8.7.4-1
libvips-tools - 8.7.4-1
libvips42 - 8.7.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vips package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.7.4-1').
